intro: Sedum pluricaule var. ezawae, commonly known as the Ezawa's stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, yellow flowers during the summer months. It is adapted to grow in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
